samples.context: Humans become capable of reproduction after puberty sets in. Children between the ages of 11 and 19 years are called adolescents. The onset of puberty brings about growth of the reproductive organs. Hair grow at various places on the body.
samples.question: What age range defines adolescents?

samples.context: Breasts develop in girls and facial hair (moustache and beard) appear in boys. Voice of boys becomes hoarse as voice box enlarges during adolescence. Children gain height during adolescence.
samples.question: What physical changes occur in boys during adolescence?

samples.context: Hormones are secretions of endocrine glands which pour them directly into the blood stream. Pituitary gland secretes hormones which include growth hormone and hormones that make other glands such as the testes, ovaries, thyroids and adrenals, secrete hormones.
samples.question: What role do hormones play during puberty?

samples.context: The uterine wall in females prepares itself to receive the developing fertilised egg. In case there is no fertilisation, the thickened lining of the uterine wall breaks down and goes out of the body along with blood. This is called menstruation.
samples.question: What happens to the uterine wall if there is no fertilization?

samples.context: It is important to eat balanced food and maintain personal hygiene during adolescence. You may come across many other myths and taboos. Discard them.
samples.question: Why is personal hygiene important during adolescence?
